cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is not an active heatwave.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: There was a torrential downpour today where the rain reached a maximum intensity of 16.6mm per hour (ranked 2nd in our records).  The storm lasted 3.2 hours and 5.69mm of precipitation fell during that time.  27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

storm.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.
A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This rainy period is ranked 4th since records began in August 2024.  The current stretch started on 26 August 2025 and has lasted 10 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (195°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 65.09 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 7 mbar) and rainfall (up 1.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.2 mm), cloud levels (up 1098 m), feels like temperature (up 2.8°C), and outside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 389.6m higher than yesterday, 4.0m lower than the past week, 1097.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 565m to 1838m and averaged 1500.1m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; warm but comfortable temperatures are expected. Also, humidity should not be a concern and very little to no wind will be present. Light to moderate rain is forecast, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and very bright daylight. Weather could become unsettled.
